page.title: 07MOUNT GRACE PRIORY
page.content: Mount Grace Priory G.R.448985 was built in 1398 and belonged to the Carthusian Order of monks.It is now in ruins,some of the stone having been used in local buildings.Each monk had his own cell rather like a house and they lead solitary lives.Food was given through a hatch by a lay brother and they attended just 2 services a day.Every monk wore a sack cloth shirt to remind them of the discomforts of life.For the past 30 years the priory has been open to the public,part of the National Trust.Mr.Haines has been curator for 18 years.On average 18000 people visit Mount Grace each year but 1985 has been a bad year with only about 13000 visitors. Many come from abroad as this is a fine example of a Carthusian priory.Digs are still taking place and relics found can be seen in the museum at the priory.
